Description: Postmarked or submitted 15 days before the election.
Postmarked or submitted 30 days before the election.
Received 29 days before Election Day.
Postmarked or submitted 30 days before Election Day.  If it falls on a Sunday, 29 days before Election Day.
If the voter registration deadline has passed, you can still conditionally register to vote and cast a provisional ballot in person at your County Elections Office through Election Day.
You can register and cast a ballot up through Election Day by appearing in-person at a Voter Service and Polling Center.
Postmarked or submitted 7 days before the election online, mail or in person. On Election Day at designated locations in each city or town.
Postmarked or submitted by the fourth Saturday before a general or primary election.
Received 21 days before the election.
Postmarked or submitted 29 days before Election Day.  If you have returned from a deployment outside the US after the deadline you can register until 5 pm, Nov. 2.
Postmarked or submitted 29 days before Election Day.
Received 29 days before Election Day.
Postmarked or submitted 25 days before Election Day. On Election Day with proof of residence at your polling place.
Postmarked or submitted 28 days before the election. In person anytime after mail deadline and on Election Day at sites designated by your county election office.
Postmarked or submitted 29 days before the election.
Received 10 days before election. On Election Day at your polling place.
Postmarked or submitted online or in person 21 days before the election if mailed.
Postmarked or submitted 29 days before the election.
Received 30 days before Election Day unless that falls on a Sunday, in which case it is 29 days before Election Day.
If mailed or from a registration drive, received by the 21st day before the election. Anytime in-person at your election office and on Election Day at your polling place.

Postmarked or submitted 20 days before the election.
Postmarked or submitted 30 days before the election.
Received 21 days before the election. On Election Day at your polling place.
Postmarked or submitted by the 5th Saturday before Election Day.
Postmarked or submitted by the 4th Wednesday before Election Day.
Postmarked 30 days before the election unless it’s a Sunday in which case it’s 29 days. In person anytime after the advance deadline at your county election office including on Election Day.
Postmarked the third Friday before the election by mail. Received in person from voter at local election office the second Friday before the election.
31 days before Election Day by mail. 21 days if online or in-person.
Received 10 days before the election by mail. On Election Day at your polling place.
Received 21 days before the election. On Election Day at your polling place.
Postmarked or submitted 28 days before the election. In person anytime after mail deadline and on Election Day at sites designated by your county election office.
Postmarked 25 days and received 20 days before the election. Submitted in-person 25 days before the election.
Postmarked or submitted 25 days before the election.
North Dakota does not have voter registration.

Received 30 days before the election. On Election Day at city or town hall in presidential year for office of president only.

Postmarked 20 days before the election. In-person by the voter the Friday before the election. On Election Day at your polling place.
You may register and vote at the same time — during the absentee voting period or on Election Day.
